EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Access (1342475803.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Access (1342475803.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Tameka, Good afternoon to youJ. Please see my responses below in blue…. From: Tameka Peoples [mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com] Sent: Saturday, July 14, 2012 6:31 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: RE: MBO Access Good morning Sara, sorry just a few follow up questions. Don’t apologize this is my job and it is my pleasure to answer any questions you may have. J - If I decide not to use the MBO American Express card program. What business name do I use to set up a Business Credit card account, that way I can use this card specifically to charge business expenses i.e. travel expenses. I actually would not recommend the MBO Amex card to be perfectly honest. It requires a lot of data upkeep in our system and while some consultants love it, I have found it to be more trouble than it’s worth. If you get your own card you may use whichever business name you would like, however you are branding yourself. - So, what happens to my take home pay & how is this portioned into the EXP account? You enter in your expenses as you incur them in to our system. We will then apply them against the next available payroll cycle. The expenses go against your income and allow that potion of your income to flow down tax free. The more expenses you have the less taxable income you will have and the more net pay you will take home. When you account is active I will walk you through entering expenses. .....So that when I expense non-billable expenses for - Travel millage to/fro work - Gas - Medical/Vision/Dental (personally healthcare) - communication (dedicated bsn phn/internet..) **Do I not get this as payment "rolled back in" until I expense to MBO. So, is this is in reference to the Top/far right column on the form you sent. I understand it's added "back in" but unless I expense this monthly I won't get paid these monies until after expense report is approved...is this correct? You do not have to worry about correlating your expenses to the week worked. You just need to enter them in to our system within 60 days of when they were incurred. We will them apply them to the next available pay cycle. If there are no expenses then the pay cycle will simply be completed without them. You do not have to have non-billable expenses to get paid for your labor. If you have a billable expense it will not be paid out to you until the client pays the invoice, just like labor. ** If above is correct is whats portioned aside as "non-billable" expenses from my gross pay those I note as "monthly non billable expenses". So, keeping this in mind I should just make sure my: medical/vision/dental, Communication and gas is noted as non billable? A non-billable expense is anything you are putting in our system that you do not want billed to the client, but rather, put against your taxable income for a tax break. When you enter an expense in our system the first question it will ask you is “client billable yes or no.” If the expenses is client billable it will be added to an invoice, if it is non-billable it will go against your taxable income and increase your take home pay. - Also, I know you indicated that I negotiate the contract terms, but in some of the MBO website references theres some indication that MBO assist's with contract help. **My biggest concern is how do I account for making sure that my contract is specific to the performance and or work statement I agree to work on with a company i.e. Booz, and also stipulating associated fees as it pertains to other contracts the same company wants me to work on with the same company. In other words I want to make sure I'm able to work into our contract that if i'm to work on any other work outside of current contract that I will be billable to that contract (i.e. the one additionally requested to work on) You negotiate the rate, we negotiate the contract (as we are ultimately the one signing the contract.) We will have our legal review and redline the contract; we will then point out things we think you should be aware of and get your permission to send our changes to the client. We will help you with any questions about the contract. I'm just trying to get my head around these few things and look forward to the information. V/R Ms. Peoples From: tpeoples1@hotmail.com <mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com> To: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com> Subject: RE: MBO Access Date: Sat, 14 Jul 2012 10:56:39 -0800Sarah, how are you and definitely not trying to disturb you on a Sat. so no worries if I don't hear from you until sometime next week. I had a questions regarding information within a PDF I've been reviewing on the website you provided me. There's a reference in the Expense PDF that indicates: Associates must confirm that they meet the qualifications for a home office to claim mileage from a home office to a client site within 50 miles. Question: How do I "confirm" that I meet home office qualifications in order to claim the milage referenced above (home to client site)...? Any information you are able to provide is greatly appreciated. V/R Ms. Peoples From: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com> To: tpeoples1@hotmail.com <mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com> Subject: RE: MBO Access Date: Thu, 12 Jul 2012 19:04:00 +0000Hi Tameka, Just left you a message, I am working from home today so just shoot me an email when you get this and I will reach out. I will be in the office all day tomorrow as well if you want to just schedule something that way we know we will reach each other J Thanks!Sara From: Tameka Peoples [mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com] <mailto:[mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com]> Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2012 2:30 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: RE: MBO Access Sara, thanks form the reply. I'm available now and in front of a computer so we can go over the numbers, please call if/when you have a moment. Cell: 916-402-5257From: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde%40mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> To: tpeoples1@hotmail.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:tpeoples1%40hotmail.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Subject: RE: MBO Access Date: Thu, 12 Jul 2012 15:41:55 +0000Hi Tameka, I am sorry I missed you yesterday! Is there a good time for me to catch you today? Looking forward to connecting… Best,Sara J From: Tameka Peoples [mailto:tpeoples1@hotmail.com] <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:%5bmailto:tpeoples1%40hotmail.com%5d?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2012 9:35 AM To: Sara Conde Cc: Marcelle Saab Subject: RE: MBO Access Hello Marcelle, and Sara thank you for the introduction I truly appreciate the assistance you've given to date. Marcelle I would defeinatly appreciate a moment of your time and look forward to the opportunity to understand the portion of the program.
V/R
Ms. Tameka Peoples Senior Cyberspace Analyst BAH/ASE Inc Client Site: 805-605-7165 Cell: 916-402-5257 -preferred contact methodFrom: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde%40mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> To: tpeoples1@hotmail.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:tpeoples1%40hotmail.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> CC: msaab@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:msaab%40mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Subject: MBO Access Date: Tue, 10 Jul 2012 19:52:00 +0000Hi Tameka, As promised, I wanted to introduce you to our MBO Access Program Manage, Marcelle Sabb. Marcelle, Tameka is going to become an MBO Associate soon, doing work with BAH and other direct clients. She is interested in getting registered with Access right away. Thanks so much!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde%40mbopartners.com&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com/?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:postmaster%40mbopartners.com&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u/IAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
